conclusion: The problem involves blocks on a green surface with object A moving them around.
The task is to determine which blocks object A will collide with and where it will stop, considering power, collision, and deflection effects.
There are multiple colored blocks scattered on a green surface, including yellow, red, orange, blue, and green blocks.
A can is partially visible on the left side.
Object A is placing multiple groups of blocks from the lower left direction and driving them in.
Power refers to how forceful object A is in pushing the blocks, collision is when blocks bump into each other, and deflection is when a block is redirected due to collision.
Object A is adding new blocks to the existing setup and pushing them towards the existing blocks.
Identify the path of object A and see where it intersects with existing blocks.
A red arrow points from the upper left towards the lower right, indicating the direction of object A's movement.
The red arrow indicates the direction of movement for object A.
Trace the path of object A to see which blocks it comes into contact with.
